Environment¶

Functions to investigate environment of star clusters.

Functions:¶

environment.compare_baryon_dm_fof(baryon_centers, dm_centers, dmmass, dmradii, boxSize=1775.0)[source]¶

For every baryon FOF object, finds the nearest DM halos (closest one and within 5, 10 ckpc)

Parameters:

  • baryon_centers (arr Nx3) – centers of mass of the baryon primary objects

  • dm_centers (arr, Mx3) – centers of mass of the DM objects

  • dmmmass (arr, M) – dark matter mass of the DM objects

  • boxSize (float) – box size in code units

Returns:

indices of closest DM object; arr, dtype = float : distances to closest DM object in code units; arr, dtype = float: masses of closest DM object in code mass; arr, dtype = bool: whether or not the object is within R200 of the closest DM; arr, dtype = int: number of DM object within 10 code units; arr, dtype = int: number of DM object within 5 code units;

Return type:

arr, dtype = int

environment.compare_baryon_env(baryon_centers, boxSize=1775.0)[source]¶

For every baryon FOF object, finds the nearest other baryon objects (closest one and within 5, 10 ckpc)

Parameters:

  • baryon_centers (arr Nx3) – centers of mass of the baryon primary objects

  • boxSize (float) – box size in code units

Returns:

indices of closest baryon object; arr, dtype = float : distances to closest baryon object in code units; arr, dtype = int: number of baryon object within 10 code units; arr, dtype = int: number of baryon object within 5 code units;

Return type:

arr, dtype = int

environment.dict_calculate(baryon_centers, dm_centers, dmmass, dmradii, boxSize=1775.0)[source]¶

Creates dictionary of

Parameters:

  • baryon_centers (arr Nx3) – centers of mass of the baryon primary objects

  • dm_centers (arr, Mx3) – centers of mass of the DM objects

  • dmmmass (arr, M) – dark matter mass of the DM objects

  • boxSize (float) – box size in code units

Returns:

dictionary containing all the output parameters of compare_baryon_env, compare_baryon_dm_fof

Return type:

dict

environment.set_up_dm_fofs(snapnum, sv, path='config.configuration.set_directories.0DMP-GS-')[source]¶

Grabs halo data corresponding to DM primary FOF with same snapnum and SV :param snapnum: :type snapnum: int or str :param sv: :type sv: str :param path: path of DM primary files WITHOUT the stream velocity indicator :type path: str

Returns:

array of total group mass, np.ndarray: array of dm group mass, array of group position [x,y,z], np.ndarray: array of group radii

Return type:

np.ndarray

environment.wrapper(directory, sv, snapnum, save=True, boxSize=1775.0, path='config.configuration.set_directories.0')[source]¶

Wrapper function. Currently there are some unused parameters and the

Parameters:

  • directory (str) – name of directory where baryon output located (ie. “SP-”, “SGP-“)

  • sv (str) – Value of stream velocity - options “Sig0” or “Sig2”

  • snapnum (str or int) – hdf5 snap output.

  • save (bool) – whether or not to save the output at path + directory + sv
